Generation V.Black: It moves along the ground as if sliding. Its swift movements befuddle its foes, and it then attacks with a vine whip.
Generation V.White: They avoid attacks by sinking into the shadows of thick foliage. They retaliate with masterful whipping techniques.
Generation V.Black 2: When it gets dirty, its leaves can't be used in photosynthesis, so it always keeps itself clean.
Generation V.White 2: When it gets dirty, its leaves can't be used in photosynthesis, so it always keeps itself clean.

Generation VI.X: It moves along the ground as if sliding. Its swift movements befuddle its foes, and it then attacks with a vine whip.
Generation VI.Y: When it gets dirty, its leaves can't be used in photosynthesis, so it always keeps itself clean.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: It moves along the ground as if sliding. Its swift movements befuddle its foes, and it then attacks with a vine whip.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: When it gets dirty, its leaves can't be used in photosynthesis, so it always keeps itself clean.

Generation IX.Scarlet: It runs low to the ground, weaving through the grass, then mercilessly pummels its target by whipping them with its vines.
Generation IX.Violet: Servine’s one weakness is its inflated sense of pride. It takes a while for Servine to be able to cooperate with other Pokémon.
